Articles.Content: Are we supposed to fill in mission names?
I hope you enjoy this one, it took a lot of work ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Are we supposed to fill in mission names?

Or maybe Astronauts/Cosmonauts? Could be both that and program/craft names.

12 down is Galileo.

Edit: Not sure actually.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T14:44:23Z" title="04/20/2015 02:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by Robotengineer**
Hmm, there is no 16 horizontal clue
No 16 across?

For a sec I thought 12 down would be Gagarin, but then I realized that it's ESA, not Roscosmos.

Also, I thought Galleilo was a NASA mission? May have been joint NASA/ESA

- - - Updated - - -

3 down is a LONG name.
I thought 3 down could be constellation, but that would be NASA

> 
> No 16 across?

Erratum: 16 across is ROSCOSMOS ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Kasper, who made the teaser images?

3 down is Curiosity.

Wait, NVM. I need to learn to count...
Kasper, are you also including Earth orbit only sattelites? Like communication sats and stuff? Though some of the Earth observation sats are likely in there.
Bet 3 across is Curiosity.

> 
> 3 down is Curiosity.
> Wait, NVM. I need to learn to count...

That's NASA, not ESA.
3 down maybe CassiniHuygen(s).

> 
> Bet 3 across is Curiosity.

Again, NASA, not ESA. Pay attention to the key on the side guys!

NVM, I was thinking of 3 down.

> 
> Bet 3 across is Curiosity.

This is possible, as it was a NASA mission. Could 4 Down be Unity then?

> 
> 3 down maybe CassiniHuygen(s).

Doesn't quite fit though.

wrong answer

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T14:52:23Z" title="04/20/2015 02:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by kookoo\_gr**

> 
> horizontal 3 cosmonaut

Unlikely as it is not NASA related

> 
> Doesn't quite fit though.

CasiniHuygens fits.
20 horizontal is Yutu?
Or maybe 20 horizontial is CNSA?
Well, I'm not much into crossword puzzles. SEVEN as the solution in the yellow marked area is pretty obvious though, so yeah, see you tomorrow for the number 6 clue...

I have to say, SQUAD, well done!

These kerbal kountdown riddles are a real treat!
